title: Love Island’s winter series will hit TV screens for ‘six weeks from 8 January’
text:
Love Island will be back sooner than we think (Picture: Rex/ITV)

Love Island will return to screens in early January, according to TV insiders.

The winter version has promised to be the ‘hottest’ series in the show’s history with a host of fit singletons making their way to Cape Town in South Africa for the six-week run.

Although ITV have been cagey with news of the show, it has now been claimed that producers and islander handlers will be heading to the continent on New Year’s Day to give them a week to prep for the show’s launch which is expected to be 8 January.

‘Bosses are still deciding on the final date but it is thought to be January 8 – a week after staff arrives in South Africa,’ the insider alleged.

‘It has been decided that the show will run for six weeks instead of the usual eight.’

Caroline has been busy with the winter Love Island coming out soon (Picture: ITV)

Speaking to the Mail Online, the insider added that show bosses will also be using ‘test islanders to uncover the best spots in the villa to create drama’.

The news comes after Amy Hart, who appeared on the 2019 summer season, revealed that the winter and summer 2020 versions will both only last for eight weeks; the 2019 summer season ran for eight weeks.

Amy Hart claimed the show will be back for six weeks (Picture: Backgrid)

‘It is going to be two six week series next year. The summer series will also be six weeks because of Euro 2020, apparently,’ she said.

‘I think the winter series will be the most-watched show ever. It’s in a brand new villa and no one wants to go out in January, no one has any money!’

Caroline Flack will be back to host the show again, and the 39-year-old has admitted that she ‘cannot wait’ for the next series.

‘I literally cannot wait, it is going to be so hot,’ she told The Sun.

‘Probably the hottest one yet. Cape Town, can you believe it? Love Island’s twice a year now, it’s going to be mad.’

Bring on 2020.

ITV did not want to comment.
